name: 01-Use a serverless SQL pool to analyze data

properties.description: Used in lab 1 - task "Use a serverless SQL pool to analyze data"

folder.name: dp-203/01-Intro to data engineering/01-Lab-Explore Azure Synapse Analytics

content.query:
-- Lab: Explore Azure Synapse Analytics
-- Task: Use a serverless SQL pool to analyze data

SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalakevipaiva.dfs.core.windows.net/files/labs-dp-203/01/product_data/products.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
        --,HEADER_ROW = TRUE -- Note the results consist of four columns named C1, C2, C3, and C4; 
    ) AS [result]           -- and that the first row in the results contains the names of the data fields. To fix this problem, add a HEADER_ROW = TRUE


SELECT
    Category, COUNT(*) AS ProductCount
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalakevipaiva.dfs.core.windows.net/files/labs-dp-203/01/product_data/products.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION='2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
GROUP BY Category

-- select the Chart view, and then select the following settings for the chart
-- Chart type: Column
-- Category colunn: Category
-- legend Series columns: ProductCount
